Title: Different from the Others
Notes: The first film supportive of homosexuality.

Title: Michael
Notes: Claude is a painter who falls in love with his assistant, Michael. Michael eventually leaves Claude for a woman.

Title: The Maltese Falcon
Notes: In the novel upon which the film is based, Cairo is referred to as "queer" and a "fairy" but, in the film, his sexuality is not directly addressed, likely a decision by filmmakers to comply with the Hays Code, which banned the depiction of homosexuality in American films.

Title: All About Eve
Notes:
Addison is a gossip columnist who engages in loveless relationship predation.
(The constraints of the Motion Picture Production Code did not allow homosexuality to be portrayed overtly.)

Title: Rebel Without a Cause
Notes: Plato was brought in for killing a litter of puppies.

Title: Spartacus
Notes: In a deleted scene, Crassus attempts to seduce his slave Antoninus.

Title: Victim
Notes:
Melville is a barrister threatened with blackmail.
The film is credited for being important in the decriminalization of homosexuality in Britain. It is also the first British film to use the word "homosexual" in the narrative.

Title: The Trial
Notes: A closeted homosexual.

Title: The Leather Boys
Notes: Pete is Reggie's fellow biker friend.

Title: Inside Daisy Clover
Notes: An extremely intoxicated Melora Swan reveals to Daisy that she had an affair with closet homosexual Wade.

Title: Reflections in a Golden Eye
Notes: Penderton is a closeted homosexual army Major and husband to Leonora.

Title: Inadmissible Evidence
Notes: Maples is a distraught client of Barrister, Bill Maitland.

Title: No Way to Treat a Lady
Star!
Notes: Biopic about Gertrude Lawrence who, besides collaborating with him in theater productions, also had a close friendship with Coward off stage.

Title: Angel, Angel, Down We Go
Notes: Willy is a wealthy airplane manufacturer and the closeted father of Tara.

Title: The Damned
Notes: Part of a wealthy industrialist family, Konstantin is an SA officer who is part of homosexual orgy in Wiesee.

Title: Midnight Cowboy
Notes: The young student offers Joe money in exchange for giving Joe fellatio in a Times Square movie house and afterward confesses he has no money to pay him.

Title: Bloody Mama
Notes: Kevin is Fred's older cellmate who eventually became his lover.

Title: The Boys in the Band
Notes: This was the first Hollywood film in which all of the principal characters are homosexual.

Title: Little Big Man
Notes: Little Horse is a native American that holds a sacred position in the tribe.

Title: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
Something for Everyone
Notes: Konrad and Helmuth are star-crossed lovers.

Title: Tell Me That You Love Me, Junie Moon
Notes: Warren is the paraplegic friend of Junie Moon whom she meets in an institution.

Title: The Cat o' Nine Tails
Notes: Dr. Braun is a scientist and one of the innocent leads in a murder case.

Title: Diamonds Are Forever
Notes: Wint and Kidd are hit men who work for Ernst Stavro Blofeld.

Title: It Is Not the Homosexual Who Is Perverse, But the Society in Which He Lives
The Last Picture Show
Notes: Coach Popper is closeted and married to Ruth.

Title: Pink Narcissus
Notes: Pan is a young and attractive male escort.

Title: Shaft
Notes: Rollie is the bartender at a bar that Shaft frequents.

Title: Some of My Best Friends Are...
Notes: On Christmas Eve of 1971, in Greenwich Village, a group of gay men and lesbians meet at the Blue Jay Bar to talk about their lives and relationships.

Title: Sunday Bloody Sunday
Notes: Hirsh is a gay Jewish doctor.

Title: Vanishing Point
Notes: The two men hitchhike while standing next to a broken-down car with a "Just Married" sign on the back. Kowalski picks them up and they attempt to rob him before he throws them out of the car.

Title: Blacula
Notes: Bobby and Billy are lovers and interior decorators. They purchase the coffin containing Blacula and ship it to Los Angeles, becoming his first victims.

Title: Georgia, Georgia
Notes: Herbert is Georgia's manager.

Title: Pete 'n' Tillie
Notes: Jimmy is Tillie's close friend.

Title: Play It as It Lays
Notes: B.Z. is a suicidal movie producer and best friend of Maria.

Title: X Y & Zee
Notes: Gordon is a close friend of Zee's.

Title: A Bigger Splash
Notes: Semi-fictionalized documentary biopic about Hockney.

Title: Day for Night
Notes: Alexandre is an actor whose lover is killed in a car accident.

Title: The Day of the Jackal
Notes: Bernard is picked up by the Jackel at a Turkish bathhouse and murdered.

Title: Ludwig
Notes: Ludwig has doubts if he can be a good husband to Sophie who loves him, and he postpones and eventually cancels the marriage. Instead, he starts having relationships with his servants, although being a devout Catholic makes him feel guilt about his homosexuality.

Title: Scarecrow
Notes: Riley is an inmate who sexually assaults Lion in prison.

Title: Sleeper
Notes: Jeb is a futuristic gay man that has a gay robot.

Title: Summer Wishes, Winter Dreams
Notes: Bobby comes out to his parents at 15 and later moves to Amsterdam.

Title: Theatre of Blood
Notes: Meredith is the theatre critic who wears a pink suit and has two poodles.

Title: 125 Rooms of Comfort
Notes: Billie is left with ownership of his father's hotel after he dies.

Title: The Conversation
Notes: Martin is the Director's loyal assistant.

Title: The Night Porter
Notes: Bert is a German dancer.

Title: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
A Very Natural Thing
Notes:
David is a public school teacher and former monastic monk. He meets Mark at a disco. After their relationship ends he meets Jason, a photographer who came out after divorcing his wife.
The film contains documentary footage of the Christopher Street Liberation Day March in New York City (known today as NYC Pride March).

Title: Barry Lyndon
Notes: While on the run, Barry stumbles upon two soldiers in a pond, naked and holding hands, professing their love for each other. He takes the uniform of one of the men in an attempt to steal his identity.

Title: Deep Red
Notes: Carlo is Marucs' best friend.

Title: The Eiger Sanction
Notes: Miles is an assassin.

Title: Fox and His Friends
Notes: Fox is a working-class gay man who wins the lottery.

Title: Funny Lady
Notes: Bobby is Fanny's assistant and friend.

Title: Mahogany
Notes: Sean is a fashion designer who works with Tracy.

Title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Notes: Dale is a patient at the mental institution.

Title: Saturday Night at the Baths
Notes: Scotti manages a bathhouse and falls in love in love with Bisexual piano player, Michael.

Title: The Sunday Woman
Notes: Massimo is Anna's best friend.

Title: L'Alpagueur
Notes: Gilbert is a killer and crook who has feelings for a young man he hires to rob a jewelry store.

Title: The Best Way to Walk
Notes: In a vacation camp somewhere in the French country in 1960, Marc and Philippe are two of the counsellors.

Title: Car Wash
Notes: Lindy is the flamboyant, yet unashamed gay employee of the car wash.

Title: Drum
Notes: Bernard is a villainous plantation owner in 19th century New Orleans.

Title: Face to Face
Notes: Dr. Jacobi is a close friend of Dr. Jenny.

Title: The Man Who Fell to Earth
Notes: Oliver is a lawyer and Newton's business partner.

Title: Next Stop, Greenwich Village
Notes: Bernstein has a Norwegian lover and becomes close friends with Larry and Sarah after they move to Greenwich Village.

Title: Norman... Is That You?
Notes: Norman is Ben's only child. Garson is Norman's lover.

Title: Ode to Billy Joe
Notes: Billy Joe is a high school student in Mississippi who jumps off of a bridge due to the shame he feels for being gay.

Title: The Ritz
Notes:
Chris befriends Jack, a heterosexual businessman who goes into hiding from his murderous mobster brother-in-law at a gay bathhouse in Manhattan. Chris shows him the ropes.
Claude is the "chubby chaser" who regularly patronizes the bathhouse.

Title: Swashbuckler
Notes: Durant is the tyrannical and cruel governor of Jamaica.

Title: The Choirboys
Notes: Blaney is a closeted high school student who gets murdered.

Title: Hidden Pleasures
Notes: Eduardo is a middle-aged, closeted banker from a wealthy family, who falls in love with a much younger heterosexual man.

Title: Looking for Mr. Goodbar
Notes:
Gary is a repressed homosexual who flies into a rage and murders Theresa when she suggests that he might be gay.
The film was inspired by the 1973 murder of New York City schoolteacher Roseann Quinn.

Title: Outrageous!
Notes: Robin is a hairstylist who creates a drag act to earn extra money after his schizophrenic friend, Liza, becomes pregnant and needs to move in with him.

Title: The Private Files of J. Edgar Hoover
Rituals
Notes: Martin is one of five doctors who are targeted by a killer while they are on group camping trip for the weekend.

Title: A Special Day
Notes: Set in Rome in 1938, the narrative follows Antonietta and her neighbor, Gabriele, who stay home the day Adolf Hitler visits Benito Mussolini; the same day that Gabriele comes out to her.

Title: The Betsy
Notes: Loren is the closeted son of a tycoon.

Title: Bloodbrothers
Notes: Paulie is a jewelry salesman who has a strained relationship with his father.

Title: California Suite
Notes: Sidney is a closeted antique dealer and husband of movie star, Diane Barrie.

Title: A Different Story
Notes:
A gay man and a lesbian who become temporary housemates end up falling in love with each other.
Film critic Janet Maslin's original review elaborates: "The movie's use of [Albert and Stella's] homosexuality is indeed exploitative, insensitive, and offensive in a variety of ways. Even worse, it is unconvincing ... Albert's homosexuality is nothing but a gimmick, something for the screenplay to coax him out of."

Title: El diputado
Notes: Roberto gets elected as Deputy and falls in love with Juanito.

Title: Nighthawks
Notes: Jim is a geography teacher who goes to gay pubs at night. His students ultimately challenge him with questions as to whether he is "bent" (i.e. homosexual). He responds that he is and answers their questions about his homosexuality calmly.
Hugh is George's best friend.

Title: Saint Jack
Notes: The film's subplot involves a closeted and married conservative senator who flies to Singapore to pick up male prostitutes.

Title: Savage Weekend
Notes: Nicky is one of the members of a friend group who go away for the weekend and are stalked by a masked killer.

Title: Cruising
Notes:
Ted is the next-door neighbor of undercover cop Steve. The two become friends while Steve works to track down a serial killer targeting gay men.
Gregory is Ted's boyfriend.

Title: Fame
Notes: Montgomery is a student in the Drama department who comes out to his peers during their second year.

Title: Happy Birthday, Gemini
Notes: On the eve of his 21st birthday, Francis realizes that he is in love with his girlfriend's brother, Randy.

Title: The Last Married Couple in America
Notes: Donald and Reggie are the neighbors of Jeff and Marie. While most couples that Jeff and Marie know have crumbling relationships, Donald and Reggie are well adjusted and happy.

Title: Life and Death
Notes: A medical student.

Title: The Long Good Friday
Notes: Colin is the gay underworld lieutenant whose murder triggers a bloodbath.

Title: Serial
Notes: Luckman is an executive headhunter by day and the head of a gay motorcycle gang by night.

Title: Squeeze
Notes: Paul is a timid young man who develops a relationship with bisexual businessman, Grant.

Title: Stir Crazy
Notes:
A drag-wearing convict who killed his stepfather.
(For his drag performance, Brown was nominated for the 1980 Golden Raspberry (Razzie) Award as "Worst Supporting Actress".)

Title: Taxi zum Klo
Notes: The film explores the life of schoolteacher Frank, as he ponders whether to continue a life on anonymous sex or settle down with his eventual boyfriend, Bernd.

Title: The Fan
Notes: Douglas is the obsessed fan of film star Sally Ross.

Title: Mad Max 2
Notes: The Golden Youth is a punk on a motorcycle in post-nuclear society.

Title: Only When I Laugh
Notes: Jimmy a struggling actor and the best friend of Georgia.

Title: Angel
Notes: Michalis is a young man in Athens, Angelos, who keeps his sexual identity a secret from his family. He falls hard for a rough sailor, Mihalis, and moves in with him.

Title: Deathtrap
Notes: Sidney and Clifford are lovers trying to do away with Sidney's wife.

Title: Drifting
Notes: Robi is a young man trying to find love and break into the movie business.

Title: Evil Under the Sun
Notes: Rex is a gossip columnist in the process of writing a biography of Arlene Stuart Marshall.

Title: Forty Deuce
Notes: Ricky is a street hustler in Times Square.

Title: Luc or His Share of Things
Notes: After coming out as gay, Luc grapples with depression and suicidal thoughts but is saved by the acceptance and support of his friends, François and Louis.

Title: Making Love
Notes: Considered a Hollywood landmark film, for its portrayal of the relationship between Zack and Bart as equally valid to a heterosexual one.

Title: Victor/Victoria
Notes: Toddy is an aging performer at Club Chez Lui in Paris.

Title: The Year of Living Dangerously
Notes: Wally is an Australian journalist.

Title: The Dresser
Notes: During World War II, Norman works as a dresser who falls in love with an actor he serves.

Title: Self Defense
Notes: While the police are on strike, a fascist group goes to a gay bar and begins murdering the patrons. Daniel is the sole bar patron that escapes and he takes refuge in a local apartment.

Title: Staying Alive
Notes: Butler is replaced as the lead dancer in a Broadway show by Tony.

Title: To Be or Not to Be
Garbo Talks
Notes: Bernie is a kindhearted gay man on Fire Island who helps Gilbert find reclusive Hollywood legend Greta Garbo for his mother as her dying wish.

Title: Horror Vacui
Notes: Hannes attempts to save his lover, Frankie, by stopping him from joining a religious cult.

Title: Irreconcilable Differences
Notes: Howard becomes Lucy's secretary after she achieves great success as a writer.

Title: La Muerte de Mikel
Notes: Mikel falls in love with a drag queen and is murdered by his mother.

Title: Meatballs Part II
Notes: Felix is the closeted gay assistant of Colonel Hershy.

Title: Mike's Murder
Notes: Philip is the sympathetic and straightforward record producer who was in a relationship with Mike prior to his murder.

Title: Protocol
Notes: Jerry and Ben are in a committed relationship and are the roommates of Sunny.

Title: Revenge of the Nerds
Notes: Lamar is an openly gay fraternity member.

Title: Adiós, Roberto
Notes: Marcelo is the roommate of Roberto.

Title: After Hours
Notes: Mark is a novelist who picks up Paul.

Title: The Boys Next Door
Notes: Chris is the ill-fated gay bar patron who unknowingly invites two killers to his apartment on the evening of their murder spree.

Title: Buddies
Notes:
David is the volunteer "buddy" from the Gay Center who is assigned to help care for Robert, who is dying of AIDS. The film explores how David copes with Robert's illness and death.
It is the first narrative film about the AIDS crisis, preceding television film, An Early Frost (also released in 1985).

Title: Colonel Redl
Notes: Redl is head of the Austrian Imperial Secret Service who gets exposed as a gay spy.

Title: Kiss of the Spider Woman
Notes:
Luis is a prisoner who survives through recreating old movie fantasies.
(Hurt won an Academy Award for his performance.)

Title: Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters
Notes: The film depicted the life and work of the eponymous writer and activist.

Title: A Nightmare on Elm Street 2: Freddy's Revenge
Once Bitten
Notes: Sebastian is the flamboyant, stereotypically gay servant to the Countess. The film contains a running gag of Sebastian continuously "coming out" of the Countess' closet.

Title: Westler
Notes: Felix and Thomas are lovers who are divided by the Berlin Wall.

Title: The Decline of the American Empire
Mala Noche
Notes: Walt falls in love with Mexican migrant, Johnny.

Title: The Morning After
Notes: Frankie is the drag queen friend of Alex, who lets her borrow clothing while she is on the run from the police for suspicion of murder.

Title: Friends Forever
Notes: Partrick is the best friend of the main protagonist, Kristian, and develops a relationship with Mads, the captain of the soccer team.

Title: The Heart Exposed
Notes: Jean-Marc and Mathieu fall in love despite a ten-year age difference and the complication that Mathieu is the father of a five-year-old son.

Title: Radio Days
Notes: Fred's coming out is treated with compassion and understanding by his girlfriend, Bea, when he bursts into tears after hearing "I'm Getting Sentimental Over You", a song which reminds him of his departed lover.

Title: Stage Fright
Notes: Brett is one of the actors in a theater troupe being targeted by a killer wearing an owl mask.

Title: The Fruit Machine
Notes: Eddie and Michael are best friends who are on the run from a killer after they witness him murdering a drag queen at a gay club called "The Fruit Machine."

Title: Once More
Notes: The film follows Louis' life through the span of 10 years.

Title: We Think the World of You
Notes: Frank is a middle-aged man who helps support the younger and bisexual Johnny and his family.

Title: Getting It Right
Notes: Harry is the best friend of the film's protagonist, Gavin. Winthrop is Harry's boyfriend.

Title: Last Exit to Brooklyn
Notes: Black is a union strike overseer trying to hide his homosexuality in a bitter marriage.

Title: Longtime Companion
Notes:
Bruce, a wealthy man, becomes the caregiver of his lover, Sean, a soap opera writer, after he is infected with the HIV virus. The film depicts the increasing effect of HIV/AIDS on a group of gay men during eight-years, between 1981 and 1989.
Willy and Fuzzy begin a relationship and move in together.

Title: Looking for Langston
Notes: James and Beauty fall in love in 1920s Harlem.

Title: Europa Europa
Notes: Robert is gay and Solek is Jewish. They hold each other's secret in solidarity while fighting in the German Army during World War II.

Title: JFK
Notes: Willie is a male prostitute serving five years in prison for soliciting. He was romantically involved with Clay.

Title: Inside Monkey Zetterland
Notes: Brent is Monkey's brother, who is a hairdresser.

Title: Blue
Notes: This was Jarman's final experimental film and documents his last years while living with AIDS. It was released four months before his death.

Title: Even Cowgirls Get the Blues
Notes: The Countress is a femine hygiene products mogul.

Title: Farewell My Concubine
Notes: The film tells the troubled relationship between Peking opera actors Dieyi and Duan Xiaolou, and Xiaolou's wife Juxian.

Title: Grief
Notes: Mark is a writer who contemplates suicide on the one year anniversary of his lover's death.

Title: Mrs. Doubtfire
Notes: "Uncle Frank" is Daniel's brother. He and his partner "Aunt Jack" are makeup artists.

Title: Naked in New York
Notes: Chris is Jake's best friend who kisses him during a party.

Title: Philadelphia
Notes:
Beckett was fired from his employment as a senior associate attorney at the largest corporate law firm in Philadelphia after they found out he had AIDS.
Alvarez is Beckett's partner.
Philadelphia is the first major Hollywood film to deal with the subject of AIDS.

Title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
Notes: Near the end of the film, Bernadette is shocked to learn that Anthony/Mitzi was not only once married to a woman but also has a son.

Title: Der bewegte Mann
Notes: Walter is a crossdresser using the name "Waltraud".

Title: Ed Wood
Notes: Bunny is Ed's drag queen friend.

Title: A Man of No Importance
Notes: Byrne is a closeted homosexual bus conductor in 1963 Dublin. His sister tries to find him a suitable woman, but his real passion is putting on amateur theatre productions of Oscar Wilde plays, particularly Salome. The film deals with his struggle, temptation, and friendships, and how they are affected by his homosexuality.

Title: Oh! My Three Guys
Notes: Good friends Kau, Hoi and Fa are homosexual men. Hoi works in an advertising firm while Kau and Fa have not found a suitable job yet. Hoi's new female colleague Mei became interested in him.

Title: Prêt-à-Porter
Notes: Bianco and Romney are fashion designers.

Title: Pulp Fiction
Notes: He rapes Marsellus Wallace.

Title: Uncovered
Notes: César is Julia's guardian.

Title: An Awfully Big Adventure
Notes: Meredith is a manager, actor and director of a troupe.

Title: Billy Madison
Notes: The principal of the elementary school, and a former masked wrestler known as the "Revolting Blob".

Title: Carrington
Notes:
Lytton is the sadomasochistic lover of Roger.
Lytton was a founding member of the Bloomsbury Group. His homosexuality, as depicted in the film, was well known.

Title: Home for the Holidays
Notes: Tommy married his boyfriend Jack in a beach wedding.

Title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
Notes: Vida and Noxeema are drag queens.

Title: Total Eclipse
Notes: The film presents a historical account of the passionate and violent relationship between 19th-century French poets Arthur Rimbaud and Paul Verlaine, at a time of soaring creativity for both men.
Country: United Kingdom, France, Belgium, Italy, United States

Title: Dream for an Insomniac
Notes: Rob is apprehensive about coming out to his father.

Title: Flirting with Disaster
Notes: Tony and Paul are ATF agents who are in a relationship with each other.

Title: Get on the Bus
Notes: Kyle is an ex-Marine who is the midst of breaking up with his lover Randall.

Title: Hollow Reed
Notes:
Martyn, a family doctor, married Hannah to hide his homosexuality, and they divorced after he finally came out.
Tom is Martyn's lover.

Title: Indian Summer
Notes: Tonio is a rising young star of a London ballet company. Ramon is the former star-turned-choreographer of the company, who is dying of AIDs. Jack is an older Therapist who falls in love with Tonio.

Title: It's My Party
Notes: Stark, an architect who hosted a two-day party after being diagnosed with progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy, will fall into a state of mental lapse lasting for months until his death. He decides to host a party for his family and friends, at the end of which he will commit suicide by taking Seconal.

Title: Who's the Woman, Who's the Man?
As Good as It Gets
Notes: Simon is an artist living in Manhattan. We learn that his parents kicked him out for being homosexual and was abused by his father because of it. Homophobic neighbor Melvin Udall uses derogatory terms when referring to Simon, but after Simon is brutally attacked he becomes the caretaker of Simon's dog, Verdell.

Title: Bent
Notes: Max is a promiscuous gay man living in 1930s Berlin. He is at odds with his wealthy family because of his homosexuality.

Title: Chasing Amy
Notes: Hooper is a black cartoonist.

Title: Happy Together
Notes: Ho Po-Wing and Lai Yiu-Fai are a gay couple from Hong Kong with a tumultuous relationship marked by frequent separations and reconciliations. They visit Argentina together but break up after they become lost while traveling to visit the Iguazu Falls.

Title: Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil
My Best Friend's Wedding
Notes: George is Julianne's friend and confidante. He agrees to pose as her fiancé so that she can make Michael, the college friend she thought would marry her, jealous.

Title: Nowhere
Notes: Cowboy and Bart are bandmates as well as boyfriends.

Title: Wilde
Notes:
Oscar loves his wife and children, but is sexually attracted to men. He becomes obsessed with Alfred.
Alfred is Wilde's lover. Their relationship becomes a scandal resulting in Oscar's downfall.

Title: Billy's Hollywood Screen Kiss
Notes:
Billy is a photographer who falls in love with sexually ambiguous waiter/model Gabriel. He hires Gabriel
Perry is Billy's mentor, patron, and admirer.
Fernando is Billy's on-again, off-again lover. He has an open relationship, but frequently pursues Billy.

Title: Dark Harbor
Notes: David and the young man are lovers.
Steve Rubell is co-owner of the New York City disco Studio 54.

Title: Gods and Monsters
Notes: The film recounts the partly fictionalized last days of the life of film director James Whale.

Title: Hold You Tight
Notes: The story of a man living in Hong Kong who is initially drawn to a young woman, but soon finds he is more attracted to her boyfriend.

Title: Illuminata
Notes: A flamboyant theater critic.

Title: The Impostors
Notes: Sparks is an aging professional tennis player.

Title: The Object of My Affection
Notes: George is a first grade teacher.

Title: Advice from a Caterpillar
Notes: Spaz is Missy's best friend.

Title: American Beauty
Notes: Frank is closeted.

Title: Black and White
Notes: Terry is the closeted husband of a documentary filmmaker.

Title: The Boondock Saints
Notes: Smecker is an FBI agent who is assigned to the murders linked to the MacManus twin brothers.

Title: But I'm a Cheerleader
Notes:
Dolph, Clayton, Andre, and Joel are campers.
Rock is the son of Mary Brown, the founder of True Directions. Supposedly straight, he is actually closeted.
Mike is supposedly an ex-gay who helps with the process of "curing" campers of their homosexuality; however, he is clearly shown to be still attracted to men.
Lloyd and Larry are a couple described as "ex, ex-gays". Before the events of the film, they were once campers at True Directions before they defected. They help the campers sneak out and go party at a gay bar, and also give advice about dealing with one's own sexuality. They let ex-camper Dolph live with them when he is expelled from True Directions for having sex at the camp.

Title: Go
Notes: Adam and Zack are soap opera actors who are in a relationship.

Title: Second Skin
Notes: Diego is the handsome surgeon who Alberto has an affair with.

Title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
Notes: Peter is Ripley's lover later in the story.

Title: Europa Europa
Notes: Robert is gay and Solek is Jewish. They hold each other's secret in solidarity while fighting in the German Army during World War II.

Title: JFK
Notes: Willie is a male prostitute serving five years in prison for soliciting. He was romantically involved with Clay.

Title: Inside Monkey Zetterland
Notes: Brent is Monkey's brother, who is a hairdresser.

Title: Blue
Notes: This was Jarman's final experimental film and documents his last years while living with AIDS. It was released four months before his death.

Title: Even Cowgirls Get the Blues
Notes: The Countress is a femine hygiene products mogul.

Title: Farewell My Concubine
Notes: The film tells the troubled relationship between Peking opera actors Dieyi and Duan Xiaolou, and Xiaolou's wife Juxian.

Title: Grief
Notes: Mark is a writer who contemplates suicide on the one year anniversary of his lover's death.

Title: Mrs. Doubtfire
Notes: "Uncle Frank" is Daniel's brother. He and his partner "Aunt Jack" are makeup artists.

Title: Naked in New York
Notes: Chris is Jake's best friend who kisses him during a party.

Notes:
Beckett was fired from his employment as a senior associate attorney at the largest corporate law firm in Philadelphia after they found out he had AIDS.
Alvarez is Beckett's partner.
Philadelphia is the first major Hollywood film to deal with the subject of AIDS.

Notes: Near the end of the film, Bernadette is shocked to learn that Anthony/Mitzi was not only once married to a woman but also has a son.

Notes: Walter is a crossdresser using the name "Waltraud".

Notes: Bunny is Ed's drag queen friend.

Notes: Bianco and Romney are fashion designers.

Notes: He rapes Marsellus Wallace.

Notes: César is Julia's guardian.

Notes: Meredith is a manager, actor and director of a troupe.

Notes: The principal of the elementary school, and a former masked wrestler known as the "Revolting Blob".

Title: Soundless Wind Chime
Notes: An interracial love story, told through a linear narrative and a series of complex, interlocking flashbacks. Ricky, who has arrived in Hong Kong from mainland China, works as a delivery boy. He is robbed by a Swiss thief, Pascal, who admits his crime and returns the stolen item. The two eventually embark on a love affair, but through several flashbacks, it eventually becomes clear that Pascal has subsequently been killed in a road accident near their flat, which Ricky had witnessed. Some years later, Ricky visits Pascal's former home in Switzerland to find it abandoned. During his time there, he meets Pascal's doppelgänger in a man called Ueli, who nevertheless has a very different personality. They, too, fall in love and the contentment that Ricky finds enables him to reflect on the relationship he had with Pascal.

Title: Amphetamine
Notes: Daniel, an openly-gay wealthy Chinese-Australian investment banker working in Hong Kong meets and befriends Kafka, a young swimming instructor from a poor local family, who has strong religious beliefs. Kafka was sexually assaulted as a teenager by a male gang after successfully defending a young woman from being raped, and as a result, he has become impotent and a habitual user of recreational drugs. Although initially uncomfortable with Daniel's obvious sexual attraction to him, he soon sees Daniel as offering him new hope in life, and he falls deeply in love with him. But Kafka's life begins to fall apart again when his mother dies suddenly, and he attempts to end his life.

Biopic about Turing, who deciphered the code of the Enigma machine, a device used by Nazi Germany during World War II. After the end of the war, he is convicted of indecency because of his homosexuality, undergoes chemical castration, and later commits suicide.
The young Turing was close to his classmate Christopher Morcom, and they passed written encoded notes to each other. Their friendship ends when Christopher dies from bovine tuberculosis. Turing names the Enigma-breaking machine "Christopher" after him.
